abstract: Congolese militia leader Bosco Ntaganda tells judges at International Criminal Court that he is not a criminal; Ntaganda is accused of orchestrating deaths and rapes of hundreds of villagers in Ituri.
lead_paragraph: The Congolese militia leader Bosco Ntaganda, whose trial on war crimes charges opened on Wednesday told his judges on Thursday that “I am not a criminal.”

headline.main: The Hague: Warlord Offers a Defense
headline.print_headline: Europe; The Hague: Warlord Offers a Defense

snippet: The Congolese militia leader Bosco Ntaganda, whose trial on war crimes charges opened on Wednesday told his judges on Thursday that “I am not a criminal.”

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
